bn.base

Class Assignment

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • bn.util.ArrayMap<RandomVariable,Value>
        • bn.base.Assignment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Assignment, java.util.Map<RandomVariable,Value>

    public class Assignment
extends ArrayMap<RandomVariable,Value>
implements Assignment
    Base implementation of an Assignment as an ArrayMap from RandomVariables to Values.
    See Also:
    Assignment, ArrayMap

      • containsAll

        public boolean containsAll(Assignment other)
        Return true if this Assignment contains all the assignments in the given other Assignment. That is, the other Assignment is a subset of this one (or they are equal).

        Maps are not Collections according to Java, so we need to implement this method ourselves. This is quadratic time but at least no memory when using ArrayMaps (which are ArraySets, themselves ArrayLists, of Map.Entrys).

        Specified by:
        containsAll in interface Assignment
        See Also:
        ArrayMap.entrySet, ArraySet.iterator, ArrayList.iterator

      • copy

        public Assignment copy()
        Return a shallow copy of this Assignment (that is, an Assignment that contains the same assignments without copying the RandomVariables or Values).
        Specified by:
        copy in interface Assignment

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
